Package hippodrome

Class ControlCentre

  • java.lang.Object
    • hippodrome.ControlCentre

  • public class ControlCentre
extends java.lang.Object
    Place where the Spectators go to enjoy the race (at a Watching Stand) and the Broker controls the races and publishes its results.
    Since:
    0.1
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Hugo Fragata, Rui Lopes

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      ControlCentre​(int numberOfHorses)
      Creates a Control Centre.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void entertainTheGuests​()
      Start entertaining the guests (representation of the Spectators), as the Broker's actions can be considered as terminated.
      void goCheckHorses​()
      Signal given by the last Spectator which arrives at the Paddock to appraise the horses, notifying the summonHorsesToPaddock() of the Broker.
      void goWatchTheRace​()
      Changes the state of the Spectator to Watching a Race (WAR) and waits till the reportResults() of the Broker.
      void makeAMove​()
      Signal given the last horse has crossed the finish line, notifying the startTheRace() in order to relief the Broker from the state Supervising the Race (STR), as the race is over.
      void proceedToPaddock​()
      Signal given by the last pair Horse/Jockey that arrives on Paddock, notifying the waitForTheNextRace() of the Spectators.
      void relaxABit​()
      Relax a bit from the games, as this is could be the final transition of a Spectator lifecycle.
      void reportResults​()
      Signal that the race is over, having the publishing of the results by the Broker performing its job.
      void startTheRace​()
      Changes the state of the Broker to Supervising the Race (STR) and waits till the last makeAMove() is performed by a pair Horse/Jockey.
      void summonHorsesToPaddock​()
      Changes the state of the Broker to Announcing Next Race (ANR) and waits till the last goCheckHorses() from the last Spectator to arrive on Paddock.
      boolean waitForTheNextRace​()
      Changes the Spectator's state to Waiting for a Race to Start (WFRTS) and waits till the last proceedToPaddock() of the pair Horse/Jockey.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ControlCentre

        public ControlCentre​(int numberOfHorses)
        Creates a Control Centre.
        This constructor creates a Control Centre giving a number of pairs Horse/Jockeys. Plus, an instance of the repository is also given in order to report status changes on the course of its actions.
        Parameters:
        numberOfHorses - the number of pairs Horse/Jockeys which will compete against one another.

    • Method Detail

      • startTheRace

        public void startTheRace​()
                  throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Changes the state of the Broker to Supervising the Race (STR) and waits till the last makeAMove() is performed by a pair Horse/Jockey.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the wait() is interrupted.

      • entertainTheGuests

        public void entertainTheGuests​()
        Start entertaining the guests (representation of the Spectators), as the Broker's actions can be considered as terminated.

      • waitForTheNextRace

        public boolean waitForTheNextRace​()
                           throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Changes the Spectator's state to Waiting for a Race to Start (WFRTS) and waits till the last proceedToPaddock() of the pair Horse/Jockey.
        Returns:
        if the last pair Horse/Jockey has arrived on Paddock.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the wait() is interrupted.

      • goWatchTheRace

        public void goWatchTheRace​()
                    throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Changes the state of the Spectator to Watching a Race (WAR) and waits till the reportResults() of the Broker.
        This method also resets the control variable for the last race results report, the number of horses which have finished the race and the control variable for the startTheRace().
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the wait() is interrupted.

      • relaxABit

        public void relaxABit​()
        Relax a bit from the games, as this is could be the final transition of a Spectator lifecycle.

      • reportResults

        public void reportResults​()
        Signal that the race is over, having the publishing of the results by the Broker performing its job.
        Note that this method changes the value of the condition variable to the goWatchTheRace() wait condition, notifying its changes.

      • summonHorsesToPaddock

        public void summonHorsesToPaddock​()
                           throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Changes the state of the Broker to Announcing Next Race (ANR) and waits till the last goCheckHorses() from the last Spectator to arrive on Paddock.
        Note that this method also resets its proper condition variable after unlocking itself.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the wait() is interrupted.

      • proceedToPaddock

        public void proceedToPaddock​()
        Signal given by the last pair Horse/Jockey that arrives on Paddock, notifying the waitForTheNextRace() of the Spectators.
        Note that this method also resets the condition variable of itself after the notification.

      • goCheckHorses

        public void goCheckHorses​()
        Signal given by the last Spectator which arrives at the Paddock to appraise the horses, notifying the summonHorsesToPaddock() of the Broker.
        Note that this method also resets the condition variable used on the waitForTheNextRace().

      • makeAMove

        public void makeAMove​()
        Signal given the last horse has crossed the finish line, notifying the startTheRace() in order to relief the Broker from the state Supervising the Race (STR), as the race is over.
